alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Fairfield; Kershaw; Lee; Northern Lancaster; Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 9:20PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Fairfield, Lancaster, northern Lee, Chesterfield and northern Kershaw Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 919 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buford, or near Lancaster, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Cheraw, Indian Land, Waxhaw, Pageland, Great Falls, Kershaw, Chesterfield, Elgin, Heath Springs, Liberty Hill, Andrew Jackson State Park, Westville, Cheraw State Park, USC Lancaster, Irwin, Northeastern Technical College, Cassatt, Cheraw Municipal Airport and Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina near mile marker 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
